subject: Real Estate
title: Subprime: The Fuse of 2008
description: A fast breakdown of Subprime: The Fuse of 2008 for builders.

hook.text: The 2008 financial crisis didn't start on Wall Street. It started with bad mortgages in Arizona suburbs.

buildup.text: Lenders offered home loans to borrowers with poor credit â€” 'subprime' loans â€” at higher interest rates.

discovery.text: These loans were fine when prices rose. Borrowers who couldn't pay could simply sell for a profit.

twist.text: When prices stopped rising, borrowers couldn't sell or refinance. Defaults cascaded through the system.

climax.text: Subprime was only 13% of all mortgages, but it triggered the worst global recession since the 1930s.

punchline.text: A tiny slice of bad loans broke the entire system.

quiz.question: What made subprime loans function during the boom?
options: Rising home prices allowed easy exits
